title: Parameter
description: Defines an input to an API operation by location, name, and schema. Parameters can appear in four locations: 'path' (always required, name must match the {placeholder} in the path template), 'query' (case-sensitive name, appended to the URL), 'header' (case-insensitive name), and 'cookie'. The 'schema' and 'content' attributes are mutually exclusive; 'content' requires exactly one map entry.

name.description: Case-sensitive for query, header, and cookie parameters. For path parameters, must exactly match the {placeholder} token in the parent path template.

in.description: Location of the parameter. Path parameters must always have required: true. Default serialization style: 'form' for query/cookie, 'simple' for path/header.

style.description: Serialization style for the parameter value. Defaults: 'form' for query and cookie, 'simple' for path and header.

schema.description: The schema defining the type and constraints for the parameter value

explode.description: When true, array/object values generate separate parameters for each element. Default: true when style is 'form', false otherwise.

allowReserved.description: Allows reserved characters in query parameter values without percent-encoding. Only applies to 'query' parameters.

example.description: An example value for the parameter. Mutually exclusive with 'examples'.

examples.description: Map of named Example objects for the parameter. Mutually exclusive with 'example'.

content.description: Alternative to 'schema' for complex serialization. Mutually exclusive with 'schema'; must contain exactly one map entry keyed by media type string.
